model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
How did the exam go?
Well, I have a few coming up. It's almost finals season. I'm still studying for them but I think it'll be ok. How about your history exam?
The history exam went pretty well, I got a B. I think that if I would have studied more, I would have got an A.
A B is still pretty great though! Do you have more exams coming up or are you on a break now?
Yeah, I guess I am happy considering I did not have the best History teacher. I have one more final in a few days, then I am done. 
Exactly, it's hard to get good grades when you don't have the best teachers. What subject is your next final on?
My last final is on English. I think I will do well, I just have to do a little more studying. Would you be willing to help me study?
Ah, English should be easier than History. Sure, I can help you. What do you need to do exactly? Write an essay?

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Studying and Exams', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A and Speaker B talk about their studies, exams, and grades.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: No, definitely not.  Maybe you can make it out to one of my games sometime? ### Speaker B: I would love that. Hopefully I can make it this weekend. I have an exam on Friday and then hopefully I can make it there before your game. ### Speaker A: Which exam?  I had a history test last week and it was horrible.  I wish my teacher was better, or at least made the topic interesting.  It's so boring in his class that I have a hard time paying attention. ### Speaker B: It is for my sport medicine. It is the last one of the class I have made A's all year so hopefully I can pass this one also and I'll be done. ### Speaker A: Oh nice!  I wish that I could get all A's.  I'm more of a B and occasional C student.  The only guaranteed A I have is in gym, haha ### Speaker B: I think everyone gets an A in gym. I have studied really hard to get those As I want to pass with good grades. I figure it would help me get a good job afterwards. ### Speaker A: I'm sure it will.  My sister got good grades in school and ended up with a great teaching job.  I know it's not the same, but it definitely helped her.  I still am hoping that I can get a soccer scholarship, because there's no way that I'll get one for my academics. ### Speaker B: Just keep at it and try your hardest. You never know you might surprise yourself' }
```

Brief explanation: The DIALOGUE CONTEXT focuses on discussing exams and an upcoming English final. The information in MEMORY, particularly about Speaker A's history exam experience and their wish for better teacher support, does not provide any additional context or specific details relevant to preparing for the English exam. While both contexts share a general topic of exams, MEMORY does not offer specific past information that would assist in generating a more appropriate response about helping with English studies in the current dialogue.
Judgement: No
